name: renewing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
renew
renew verb [T]
(MAKE NEW)
B2 to increase the life of or replace something old: Every year I renew my membership of the sports club. I forgot to renew my season ticket. I'll use this material to renew the chair covers.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was an ominous silence when I asked whether my contract was going to be renewed.My passport runs out next month - I must get it renewed.Green plants help to renew the earth's oxygen supply.The council have refused to renew the company's operating licence.What a to-do that was, getting my passport renewed at the consulate!

renew verb [T]
(REPEAT)
to begin doing something again: The kidnappers renewed their threats. She renewed her efforts to escape.
